isis.stitle: SPICER 14 INCH (350 MM) SOLO CLUTCH - INSTALL - TWO PLATE CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

important.para: Follow this procedure if the shipping bolts were installed prior to removing the clutch cover assembly and the same driven discs are being re-used or a factory replacement clutch and disc assembly is being installed.

note.para: In the event the shipping bolts were not installed during the removal procedure or new driven discs are being installed with the existing cover assembly, the cover assembly roll pin/bolt assembly must be reset following RESETTING PROCEDURES before proceeding with Step 4.

step1.para: Install a new pilot bearing in the flywheel ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Install New Pilot Bearing in Flywheel

step1.para: Install two 3/8" x 16 x 3" long guide studs at the 11 and 1 o'clock positions on the flywheel ( Figure 19).
Install the front driven disc by inserting an alignment tool through the disc splines and into the flywheel pilot bearing ( Figure 20).

caution.para: Make sure the side marked flywheel side faces the flywheel to prevent damage to the driven disc.

note.para: Prior to installing the intermediate plate/adapter ring, insure that the four (4) separator pins (roll pins) are fully extended from the flywheel side of the ring. Lightly tap the separator pins flush on the drive strap side if necessary.

step1.para: Install the intermediate plate/adapter ring assembly over the guide studs and slide it toward the flywheel until it makes contact with the flywheel ( Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Install Intermediate Plate/Adapter Ring Assembly

note.para: The intermediate plate drive straps will be toward the transmission.

step1.para: Remove the alignment tool from the front disc and insert it in the splines of the rear disc. Install the rear disc and alignment tool into the front disc and flywheel pilot bearing making sure the friction buttons on both discs are aligned as close as possible (insert, Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Install Rear Disc and Alignment Tool

caution.para: The rear disc side marked pressure plate must be facing the pressure plate to prevent damage to the driven disc.

step1.para: Slide the cover assembly over the two guide studs and alignment tool until it contacts the intermediate plate adapter ring ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Slide Cover Assembly Over Guide Studs

step1.para: Install (6) 3/8" x 2.44" long Grade 5 min. mounting bolts and lockwashers hand tight. Remove the two guide studs and replace with two additional bolts and lockwashers. Tighten to 35 to 40 ft-lbs. (47 to 54 N•m) in a criss-cross pattern ( Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Tighten Bolts in Pattern Shown

note.para: If the clutch is a factory replacement, the shipping bolts will be colored yellow.

step1.para: Locate the (4) intermediate plate positive separator pin (roll pin) access holes in the cover assembly. Use a lightweight hammer (approx. 12 oz.) and a 1/4" flat nose punch and tap the pins against the flywheel ( Figure 27and Figure 28).
